verses.name: Job 7:5
verses.text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

verses.name: Job 7:6
verses.text: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.

verses.name: Job 7:7
verses.text: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.

verses.name: Job 7:8
verses.text: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.

verses.name: Job 7:9
verses.text: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.
